intro: Paronychia lindheimeri var. longibracteata, commonly known as the Lindheimer's paronychia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a slightly hairy texture. This variety is distinguished by its elongated bracts that accompany the flowers, giving it its specific epithet.
